name: Gregory Peck Movies Quiz | People Themed | 10 Questions

questions.text: Peck worked with Hitchcock in 'Spellbound'. The 'dream sequence' was designed by a prominent artist. Which one?
questions.explanation:
Dali.

	With Ingrid Bergman. Not Hitchcock's best.

questions.text: Peck starred in 'Gentlemen's Agreement'. Who played his Jewish friend?
questions.explanation:
John Garfield.

	Garfield, in a different kind of role for him. With Dorothy McGuire. Well done.

questions.text: Peck also did westerns. Which of the following is NOT one of his?
questions.explanation:
Sergeant Rutledge.

	'Rutledge' is a poor John Ford effort, starring Jeffrey Hunter. 'Bravados' was a revenge tale with Joan Collins. 'Moon' featured Eva Marie Saint, while 'Gold' included Julie Newmar in the cast.

Memory.

	Amnesia. With Walter Matthau as a detective.

questions.text: Peck starred in 'Arabesque'. Who was the female star?
Peck was also in 'The Boys From Brazil'. Who wrote the novel?
Peck may be best known for 'To Kill A Mockingbird'. What role did he play?
questions.explanation:
Lawyer.

	Atticus Finch, attorney. I've never understood all the fuss about this movie.

questions.text: Peck starred in the title role in 'The Gunfighter'. What happened to the character at the end of the movie?
questions.explanation:
He died.

	The past caught up with him. Too bad.

questions.text: 'Cape Fear' (the original, not the re-make) starred Peck as the hero of the movie. Who played the villain?
questions.explanation:
Robert Mitchum.

	Good suspense movie. With Polly Bergen.

questions.text: Which is NOT a Gregory Peck movie?
questions.explanation:
Magnificent Obsession.

	'Obsession' was an enjoyable Rock Hudson movie. 'Country' was a {western;} 'Hill' was a war movie. 'Moby Dick' gave Peck one of his big roles, as Ahab.
